intro: Navarretia leucocephala subsp. diffusa, commonly known as the Sierra white-flowered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has linear to lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. This subspecies is often found in the Sierra Nevada range and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
